1.text: For every high priest taken from among men, is ordained for men in the things that appertain to God, that he may offer up gifts and sacrifices for sins:

2.text: Who can have compassion on them that are ignorant and that err: because he himself also is compassed with infirmity.

3.text: And therefore he ought, as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins.

4.text: Neither doth any man take the honour to himself, but he that is called by God, as Aaron was.

5.text: So Christ also did not glorify himself, that he might be made a high priest: but he that said unto him: Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee.

6.text: As he saith also in another place: Thou art a priest for ever, according to the order of Melchisedech.

7.text: Who in the days of his flesh, with a strong cry and tears, offering up prayers and supplications to him that was able to save him from death, was heard for his reverence.

8.text: And whereas indeed he was the Son of God, he learned obedience by the things which he suffered:

9.text: And being consummated, he became, to all that obey him, the cause of eternal salvation.

10.text: Called by God a high priest according to the order of Melchisedech.

11.text: Of whom we have much to say, and hard to be intelligibly uttered: because you are become weak to hear.

12.text: For whereas for the time you ought to be masters, you have need to be taught again what are the first elements of the words of God: and you are become such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

13.text: For every one that is a partaker of milk, is unskillful in the word of justice: for he is a little child.

14.text: But strong meat is for the perfect; for them who by custom have their senses exercised to the discerning of good and evil.
